meanings.definition: To sterilize (something) before further sterilization is carried out.
meanings.sent1: Before using the medical instruments, the hospital staff must presterilize them.
meanings.sent2: It is important to presterilize the bottles before filling them with milk.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to presterilize the cutting board to ensure the vegetables stayed fresh.
meanings.sent4: The scientist presterilized the petri dish to create a clean environment for the bacteria.
meanings.sent5: To prevent contamination, the lab technician always presterilizes the equipment before each experiment.

meanings.definition: To subject (something) to a process that kills all forms of life, including spores.
meanings.sent1: The dentist will presterilize the tools to make sure they are completely clean.
meanings.sent2: Before planting the seeds, the farmer presterilized the soil to remove any harmful bacteria.
meanings.sent3: The teacher decided to presterilize the classroom to keep the students healthy.
meanings.sent4: The exterminator presterilized the entire house to get rid of all pests.
meanings.sent5: To ensure safety, the food manufacturer presterilizes all packaging before use.
